content.question: Which of the following pieces of evidence would best support the validity of the Big Five personality traits in describing human personality?

choices.label: Many companies have embraced testing the Big Five personality traits in order to screen applicants.
The Big Five have been shown to apply to individuals in many countries, including, but not limited to, Hungary, Turkey, China, Japan, and Italy.
Low conscientiousness predicts high job performance.
The Big Five do not explain all aspects of human personality (e.g., religiosity).

content.answer: The Big Five have been shown to apply to individuals in many countries, including, but not limited to, Hungary, Turkey, China, Japan, and Italy.
